observation: The search for the word 'gestalt' on the Cambridge Dictionary website has succeeded. The word is provided as both a noun and an adjective. As a noun, "gestalt" is defined as "something such as a structure or experience that, when considered as a whole, has qualities that are more than the total of its parts" with example sentences included. The pronunciation is given for both UK (/ɡəˈʃtælt/) and US (/ɡəˈʃtɑːlt/) pronunciations. Additionally, as an adjective, it is described as "considering or treating what a person experiences and believes as a whole and separate thing." Example sentences are also provided under the "EXAMPLES of gestalt" section.
